message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.GR 

The paper deals with face recognition in video surveillance, which is a common application of computer vision. The use of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for synthetic face generation is also a popular topic in computer vision research. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a new Controllable GAN (C-GAN) for face synthesis, which involves training a neural network to generate realistic images while controlling certain attributes. This falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also mentions the use of an off-the-shelf 3D face model, which involves computer graphics and modeling, and could fall under cs.GR (Graphics). Additionally, the paper involves the use of deep Siamese networks for face recognition, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence and could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper uses videos from specific datasets, which could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia).
